result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry J Polk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with the Victim listed in the criminal complaint unless approved by the agent and through the victim's mother. No Violent contact with any minor child. Participate in any additional Parenting Classes to be determined by agent. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, conditions, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for use at agent's discretion. (Huber privileges at agent's discretion)

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if revoked. See Count 1 for additional conditions.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:40 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerry J Polk in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Jerry J Polk. Atty. Helvig provides an update; he is prepared to resolve the matter and is asking for plea and sentencing date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:32 AM Defendant Jerry J Polk in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Jerry J Polk.   Defense counsel asks for another status date in 45 days.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
End of representation letter filed by Atty. Gutierrez.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant
Form emailed to US Dept of State 07/25/2022
Hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 07/25/2022:  The Defendant does not have a passport.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to physically discipline any child.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

09:28 AM Defendant Jerry J Polk in court with attorney Conner Helvig.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  Attorney Helvig is asking for an arraignment date.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court.  The Court addresses the surrender of the defendant's passport.  The defendant is sworn in and testifies that he does not have a passport.  The Court will modify the bail conditions to reflect the defendant does not have a passport.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

01:09 PM Defendant Jerry J Polk in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
